qas.question: Which Epistle details the raising of Jesus?
Which writing detailed Jesus' appearance before ascension?
How long did Jesus stay with the Apostles per the Acts of the Apostles?
What day is accounted in the Gospel of Luke as the ascension?
Who wrote both accounts of the Crucifixion and ascension?
Where did St. Luke go after he died?
How many days had Luke been an apostle?
How many people saw Jesus when he was first seen after his crucifixion?
Who was the first apostle to see Jesus afte he was raised from the dead?
How often do scholars need to revise what they have written about the Bible?

context: According to the <a0_0>First Epistle to the Corinthians<a0_0/> (1 Cor. 15:4), Jesus was raised from the dead ("on the third day" counting the day of crucifixion as the first) and according to the <a1_0>canonical Gospels<a1_0/>, appeared to his disciples <b9_0>on different occasions<b9_0/> before ascending to <b5_0>heaven<b5_0/>. The account given in Acts of the Apostles, which says Jesus remained with the apostles for <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>forty<b7_0/> days<b6_0/><a2_0/>, appears to differ from the account in the Gospel of <b8_0>Luke<b8_0/>, which makes no clear distinction between the events of <a3_0>Easter Sunday<a3_0/> and the Ascension. However, most biblical scholars agree that <a4_0>St. Luke<a4_0/> also wrote the Acts of the Apostles as a follow-up volume to his Gospel account, and the two works must be considered as a whole.
